awd_titl_txt: Imaging and Photometric Observations of four Airglow        Emissions During AIDA Act '89 at Arecibo
awd_abstract_narration: In the spring of 1989 an extensive campaign will take                      place at the Arecibo Observatory in Puerto Rico. This study on                  the dynamics of the mesosphere and lower thermosphere will                      combine the largest collection of instruments ever assembled at                 one location to study this important region of the atmosphere.                  This award provides for the inclusion of a number of                            photometric and imaging optical instruments  in this campaign                   in order to maximize the participation and obtainable science                   in this endeavor.  The overall program will include the Arecibo                 incoherent scatter radar, coherent radars, meteor radars,                       optical imagers and spectroscopic, interferometric and                          photometric instruments distributed at a number of locations in                 Puerto Rico.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
